intro: Ardisia multicaulis, commonly known as the clustered ardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are an attractive feature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
